edu.chop.dgd.dgdObjects

Class Digraph<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.chop.dgd.dgdObjects.Digraph<V>

  • public class Digraph<V>
extends java.lang.Object
    An example class for directed graphs. The vertex type can be specified. There are no edge costs/weights. Written for CS211, Nov 2006.
    Author:
    Paul Chew

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Digraph() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(V vertex)
      Add a vertex to the graph.
      void add(V from, V to)
      Add an edge to the graph; if either vertex does not exist, it's added.
      java.util.Map bfsDistance(V start)
      Report (as a Map) the bfs distance to each vertex from the start vertex.
      boolean contains(V vertex)
      True iff graph contains vertex.
      java.util.Map<V,java.lang.Integer> inDegree()
      Report (as a Map) the in-degree of each vertex.
      boolean isDag()
      True iff graph is a dag (directed acyclic graph).
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main program (for testing).
      java.util.Map<V,java.lang.Integer> outDegree()
      Report (as a Map) the out-degree of each vertex.
      void remove(V from, V to)
      Remove an edge from the graph.
      java.util.List<V> topSort()
      Report (as a List) the topological sort of the vertices; null for no such sort.

      String representation of graph.

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        String representation of graph.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • add

        public void add(V vertex)
        Add a vertex to the graph. Nothing happens if vertex is already in graph.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(V vertex)
        True iff graph contains vertex.

      • add

        public void add(V from,
       V to)
        Add an edge to the graph; if either vertex does not exist, it's added. This implementation allows the creation of multi-edges and self-loops.

      • remove

        public void remove(V from,
          V to)
        Remove an edge from the graph. Nothing happens if no such edge.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either vertex doesn't exist.

      • outDegree

        public java.util.Map<V,java.lang.Integer> outDegree()
        Report (as a Map) the out-degree of each vertex.

      • inDegree

        public java.util.Map<V,java.lang.Integer> inDegree()
        Report (as a Map) the in-degree of each vertex.

      • topSort

        public java.util.List<V> topSort()
        Report (as a List) the topological sort of the vertices; null for no such sort.

      • isDag

        public boolean isDag()
        True iff graph is a dag (directed acyclic graph).

      • bfsDistance

        public java.util.Map bfsDistance(V start)
        Report (as a Map) the bfs distance to each vertex from the start vertex. The distance is an Integer; the value null is used to represent infinity (implying that the corresponding node cannot be reached).

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main program (for testing).
